head.title: Some Drivers Engender Fear Rather Than Respect

identified-content.classifier: Utility Vehicles and Other Light Trucks

hedline.hl1: Some Drivers Engender Fear Rather Than Respect

abstract.p: Sharon Alpert letter on Janette Barnes' April 30 article on women driving sport-utility vehicles holds such vehicles engender fear rather than respect

block.p: I speak as the driver of a car that screams ''Mom'' (a 1993 Toyota Camry wagon). Let me assure the women who drive these monster trucks to ferry the kids to and from activities that their S.U.V.'s scream ''Mom'' every bit as loudly as any minivan or wagon on the road.

What some drivers of these S.U.V.'s mistakenly label as respect, is, in fact, fear -- fear of the damage they can inflict on other, smaller vehicles and fear of how they restrict the other drivers' ability to see the road. I also worry about those S.U.V. drivers who, feeling invulnerable, might take undue risks.
